alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 12:12PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN PULASKI AND WYTHE COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 PM EDT... At 1212 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fort Chiswell, or near Max Meadows, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Wytheville... Max Meadows... Patterson... Speedwell... Fort Chiswell... Cripple Creek... and Grahams Forge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
